first-international.name: August Bebel
first-international.description: Co-founder of the German Social Democracy with Wilhelm Liebknecht in 1869. Part of the Reichstag from 1867. Outstandingly argued for the emancipation of women's rights before capitalism could be overthrown.

first-international.name: Eugene Pottier

first-international.description: German socialist, contemporary and critic of Marx.

first-international.name: Frederick Lessner
first-international.description: German Revolutionary, comrade of Marx in the Communist League in the 1840s.

first-international.name: Friedrich Adolphe Sorge
first-international.description: After fighting in the 1848 Revolution in Germany, he fled to America; later Secretary of the First International; Marx's closest supporter in the US.

first-international.name: Friedrich Engels
first-international.description: German philosopher, social scientist, journalist, and businessman. Co-founder of Marxism with Karl Marx. Best known for his contributions to revolutionary theory and his support of the working-class movement.

works.title: The Condition of the Working Class in England

first-international.name: Jenny Marx Longuet
first-international.description: Fought for Irish independence from England. Detailed the atrocities against Irish political prisoners in England. Braved a narrow escape from France after the massacres of the Paris Commune. Marx's eldest daughter.

first-international.name: Johann Georg Eccarius
first-international.description: German communist, supported Marx in the International and in British trade unions.

first-international.name: Joseph Dietzgen
first-international.description: Created dialectical materialism independently of Marx & Engels, but on seeing their writings became their most ardent supporter. His main contributions were using dialectics to elaborate epistemology.

works.title: The Nature of Human Brain Work

first-international.name: Jules Guesde
first-international.description: French socialist. Leader of the Marxist wing of the French workers' movement.

first-international.name: Karl Marx
first-international.description: German philosopher, economist, and revolutionary socialist. Co-founder of Marxism and author of Das Kapital and the Communist Manifesto. Developed the theory of historical materialism and critique of political economy.

first-international.name: Karl Marx & Fredrick Engels
first-international.description: Co-founders of Marxism and key figures in the First International. Marx drafted the foundational documents of the International Working Men's Association.

first-international.name: Lucien Sanial

first-international.name: Paul Lafargue

first-international.name: Victor Considerant

first-international.name: Wilhelm Liebknecht
first-international.description: German Revolutionary, comrade of Marx in the Communist League in the 1840s.
